alert.note: Alert for Harrison; Lewis; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 11:44PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Lewis, northwestern Upshur and south central Harrison Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1144 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Stonewall Jackson, or near Weston, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Buckhannon, Weston, Stonewall Jackson, Jackson Mill, Lost Creek, Jane Lew, Camden, Lorentz, Tallmansville and Horner. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 88 and 113. Route 33 between mile markers 1 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
